description: Number of n X n symmetric matrices whose first row is 1..n and whose rows and columns are all permutations of 1..n.
comments: The odd subsequence is presumably A000438, which gives more terms. The even subsequence is A035483.
example: a(3) = 1 because after 123 in the first row and column, 213 is not allowed for the second row, so it must be 231 and thus the third row is 312.
mathematica: (* This script is not suitable for n > 6 *) matrices[n_ /; n > 1] := Module[{a, t, vars}, t = Table[Which[i==1, j, j==1, i, j>i, a[i, j], True, a[j, i]], {i, n}, {j, n}]; vars = Select[Flatten[t], !IntegerQ[#]& ] // Union; t /. {Reduce[And @@ (1 <= # <= n & /@ vars) && And @@ Unequal @@@ t, vars, Integers] // ToRules}]; a[0] = a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Length[ matrices[n]]; Table[an = a[n]; Print["a(", n, ") = ", an]; an, {n, 0, 6}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Jan 04 2016 *)
